data.title: Reveal map on mission success
data.body: While i was doing some testing, I noticed that even when you successfully complete a mission you don't get to see the whole map. Would be nice if the map was revealed sort of as a reward for successful mission completion.

data.title: Overhaul the observer sidebar.
data.body:
![replay](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/4605336/3c9abe9c-51dc-11e4-99ff-3ad5ed43483a.png)

This updates the RA observer sidebar to match the new theme, and adds a 200% playback speed option to all four mods.

data.title: Donâ€™t regenerate the Lua player bindings each query.
Unified directory/namespace layout
data.body:
Before OpenRA.Mods.Common gets too far, a standard layout of directories and namespaces should be created to (eventually) organize all mods including external ones. 
Obviously, namespaces will be the same as the directory paths with `.` instead.

Option 1 - based largely on current OpenRa.Mods.\* & OpenRA.Game:
- Activities
- AI
- Commands
- Effects
- FileFormats
- FileSystem
- GameRules
- Graphics
- Lint
- Orders
- Player
- Primatives
- Render
  - Modifiers
- Scripting
  - Global
  - Properties
  - Player
  - World
- Server(Traits)
- SpriteLoaders
- SupportPowers
- Traits
- UtilityCommands
- Warheads
- Widgets
  - Logic
- World(Traits)

Option 2:
- Commands
- FileFormats
- FileSystem
- GameRules
- Graphics
- Lint
- Primatives
- SpriteLoaders
- UtilityCommands
- Widgets (main widgets for mod)
  - Logic
- <Category> - grouped by functionality, usually in a separate namespace. <Category> must not be one of the above.
  - Activities
  - AI
  - Effects
  - Interfaces.cs - or -
  - Interfaces
    - Traits.cs
    - <Sub-category>.cs
  - Orders
  - Render
    - Modifiers  - or - just RenderModifiers
  - Scripting
    - Global - Lua globals (not a namespace)
    - Properties - Actor script properties (not a namespace)
      - Player - for the `Player` actor (not a namespace)
      - World - for the `World` actor (not a namespace)
  - SupportPowers
  - Traits
    - Player (not a namespace)
    - World (not a namespace)
  - Warheads
  - Widgets
    - Logic
      Category names should agree between mods based on functionality.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/5230004-unified-directory-namespace-layout?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Moved RenderSprites.cs from Mods.RA to Common
data.body:
Moved file RenderSprites.cs.
Moved interface IRenderActorPreviewInfo  from OpenRA.Mods.RA/TraitsInterfaces.cs  to  OpenRA.Mods.Common/CommonTraitsInterfaces.cs.
Naturally, a lot of "using"s needed to be added.

Note: I intentionally left a ton of unused "using" statements to reduce the number of differences and facilitate reviewing. I will do a clean-up for these at some point. (when more files are moved perhaps).

data.title: Moved a few more traits to Mods.Common
data.body:
- BlocksBullets
- DeathSounds
- ActorLostNotification
- AnnounceOnBuild
- AnnounceOnKill

data.title: Fix old Lua breakage
data.body:
Works around a problem in the old Lua API where a trait lookup would
not find the correct class and make the script crash.

In this instance, `Game.modData.ObjectCreator.FindType("RallyPoint")`
returns `OpenRA.Mods.Common.Effects.RallyPoint` instead of the expected
`OpenRA.Mods.Common.RallyPoint`.

I only commented that line instead of removing it so that I won't forget about it when I port the mission to the new API.

The other change is an oversight from the recent warhead rewrites.

Fixes #6728.

data.title: Transform keeps sub-cell if Mobile else center position if not to/from building
data.body: fixes #6639

data.title: Fix Eluant.dll reference in Common project. Requested in #6723.
data.body: As requested in #6723, the reference fix has been moved to its own commit.

data.title: Updated the release build servers to Mono 3.8
data.body: Reverts the reverts from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6672 but locks the version to 3.8 which worked fine https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6605.

data.title: Fixes TS smudges...
data.body:
...and Laser Turret + SAM Site selection bounds.

The smudges were using the (empty) shadow frame when "growing", causing them to become invisible.
Furthermore, most weapons had no smudges defined yet.

data.title: Load assets using absolute file paths
data.body:
This should allow any utility command and the game itself to be run from any directory.

Fixes #6717 and other frustrations caused by utility commands that previously only worked in the root directory.

data.title: Moved two more Orders from RA to Common
data.body:
Moved  Orders\EnterAlliedActorTargeter.cs  and  Orders\UnitOrderTargeter.cs  from OpenRA.Mods.RA to OpenRA.Mods.Common.
Also made a fix to an uncommon build issue regarding Common's reference to Eluant.dll. Not so much a problem as for consistency with the same reference in the other projects as they all reference it this way.

data.title: Disallow changing tanya's stance on allies01
data.body: It was possible to set stance to attackanything again.

data.title: Tiberian Sun CD - setup.mix
data.body:
i buyed Tiberian Sun German CDs with Firestorm and i found a Directory named "Setup" which contains a Setup.mix which also contains:
- Bitmaps
- Setup background music
- some sound effects
- fnt files
- palettes
- shp files

![ts_setup mix](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2057932/4573848/8efe2720-4f96-11e4-94ab-dd3fa49d80dc.png)

i can upload the content for further research maybe we can take use of this content :)

https://github.com/LipkeGu/TSIniFiles/blob/master/ts_setup.zip

data.body: Prerequisites changed

data.title: [TS] World Domination Tour Mode (WDT)
data.body:
World Domination Tour worse introduced in Tiberian Sun Firestorm and also available to Red Alert 2 ... 
Westwood has shutdown these Servers a long time ago 

So i ask when TS is almost released and Firestorm Support is also done, so we could implement this Feature for both versions... TS So we need only to implement it for TS-FS and adapt it later for RA2 when openRA is RA2 ready :)

First step in moving all the not-mod-specific code from project OpenRA.Mods.RA to OpenRA.Mods.Common.
Pretty much a test commit. Includes only 1 file moved and "using" statements added to the 7 files that use it.

data.title: Radiated ground after any given effect.
data.body:
Make a way to radiate terrain tiles with an ominous glow with a programmable RGB color effect, and a consequential effect for keeping a unit in there too long.

Example, ion cannon can leave a red glow for a very hot terrain that will burn up a unit. nuclear missile can leave a red glow for a poisoned terrain that should melt the unit.
